author: potatoqualitee
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

I love `clip`! It works on Windows, but not on Mac. Can we get an alias for `clip` to `Set-Clipboard`? I didn't even realize that `Set-Clipboard` worked until someone highlighted it in a chat room.

Would be great for have an xplat alias for clip. On Mac, I had to research and find some mclip thing.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Aliases are bad practice for scripts, but they can be convenient in an interactive session, which is a personal preference of the user to configure the session. Therefore, the general rule is to put the alias settings in PowerShell user profile.

comments.author: potatoqualitee
comments.body: Sure, but we do offer some built-in alises. `sls`, for example. I found out yesterday that the current alias for `Set-Clipboard` is `scb`. Perhaps that can be changed to `clip` instead? My profile currently sets `clip` to `pbclip`, but it would be nice to have it universally available and set to `Set-Clipboard` instead.

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body: You are free to set any aliases you like in your profile

comments.author: potatoqualitee
comments.body: That response seems unnecessary, as I've demonstrated throughout my comments that I'm aware that aliases can be made. I would have appreciated a more substantial comment to end the conversation.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> Sure, but we do offer some built-in alises. `sls`, for example.

The conclusion was to remove conflicting aliases, but keep the rest for backward compatibility, and not to add new aliases in PowerShell distribution.

comments.author: potatoqualitee
comments.body: Ahh I'd forgotten about that, thanks @iSazonov

title: `clip` alias for `Set-Clipboard`
